column4: I can't figure out what software I can use for riping and burning backup images of my copy protected cdroms (mostly games) anyone know of anything that's remotely user friendly and easy to install?
has a lot of kde deps.. I'm running a gnome based system
any alternatives, or should I just grin and bear it?
k3bis as good as or better than nero ...
k
thx
right click on the cd icon on the desktop .... eject
that would work if I wanted to eject it.. But I don't. =p
then umount /media/cdrom
K3b won't work if it's mounted it seems, and I can't find an easy way to unmout it w/o going to a terminal
you want to what ? burn the image ?
to read the image yes
read or write ...
read
read then why you need k3b ? k3b is a burning software
I have to READ an image so I can then write it to a new (backup) cd
you got two cd or dvd drives ?
no, just one. I am using clone, but it needs me to unmount the cdrom drive before it will work
ah k...
he is using windows
you can write ya own shell script then put a link on it on desktop ?
